framever.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // $Id: framever.c,v 1.4 2008/02/27 07:47:54 richter Exp $
00002 
00003 /****************************************************************************
00004 *
00005 * Frameverifier - framever
00006 *
00007 **
00008 ** This file is property of and copyright by the Experimental Nuclear 
00009 ** Physics Group, Dep. of Physics and Technology
00010 ** University of Bergen, Norway, 2006
00011 ** This file has been written by Dominik Fehlker
00012 ** Please report bugs to dfehlker@htwm.de
00013 **
00014 ** Permission to use, copy, modify and distribute this software and its  
00015 ** documentation strictly for non-commercial purposes is hereby granted  
00016 ** without fee, provided that the above copyright notice appears in all  
00017 ** copies and that both the copyright notice and this permission notice  
00018 ** appear in the supporting documentation. The authors make no claims    
00019 ** about the suitability of this software for any purpose. It is         
00020 ** provided "as is" without express or implied warranty.                 
00021 **
00022 * a utility to verify frames from the Xilinx memory against the ones and the flash
00023 * and the ones stored on a drive. In case of an error, and Errorfile is created
00024 * which contains the the positions of the bitflips. Also the errors are counted
00025 * for every frame, every cycle and the total number of errors during all cycles.
00026 * For a complete run a logfile log.txt will be created, containing these information.
00027 * 
00028 * usage: framever frames.txt 20
00029 *                     ^      ^- optional number of cycles, if not given a standard is used
00030 *                     '-------- File containing the frames in a way like
00031                                 block;major;minor; - for example "0;5;3;"     
00032 *
00033 * written by Dominik Fehlker, dfehlker@htwm.de, University of Applied Sciences Mittweida
00034 ******************************************************************************/
00035 #include <stdlib.h>
00036 #include <stdio.h>
00037 #include <string.h>
00038 #include <unistd.h> //for usleep
00039 #include "dcscMsgBufferInterface.h"
00040 #include "framever.h"
00041 #include <sys/stat.h>
00042 #include <sys/time.h>
00043 //#include "framehelpers.h"
00044 
00045 // for the half-baked interpreting of registers
00046 //char meaning[255];
00047 
00048 int main(int argc, char **argv){
00049    __u32 *pSrc;
00050    __u32 rawData;
00051    __u16 *pTgt, *pTgtoutput, *pRawData, *pErrFileDataoutput,*pErrFileData;
00052    __u32 *pRBData;
00053    //for the files that are opened
00054    int block, major, minor;
00055    FILE *frames;
00056    FILE *logfile;
00057    FILE *errfile;
00058    FILE *rbrawfile;
00059    FILE *rawfile;
00060    char pathandfilename[96]="";
00061    char errpathandfilename[96];
00062    char line[255];
00063    char putline[255];
00064    char foldername[96]="";
00065    int data[212];
00066    int frameaddress[3];
00067    int *pframeaddress;
00068    __u16 rawdata[212];
00069    int errfiledata[212];
00070    int cycles, result,n, linecounter, cyclestoreach, i,erroroccured, cycleserrors, linenumber, linenumbercount, overallerrors;
00071    //for the time
00072    struct tm *l_time;
00073    time_t now;
00074    char mytime[20];
00075    //for the Hardwareerrorregisters
00076    unsigned short hwnoferrorsreg;
00077    unsigned short hwnoflastframewitherr;
00078    unsigned short hwnoflastframe;
00079    unsigned short hwnofcycles;
00080    unsigned short hwstatusreg;
00081    unsigned short hwerrreg;
00082    char ReadbackRawFrameFilename[64];
00083    char RawFrameFilename[64];
00084    char ErrorFrameFilename[64];
00085    pframeaddress = &frameaddress[0];
00086    block = -1;
00087    major = -1;
00088    minor = -1;
00089    cycles = 0;
00090    cyclestoreach = 0;
00091    n = 0;
00092    i = 0;
00093    linecounter = 0;
00094    hwnoferrorsreg = 0;
00095    hwnoflastframewitherr = 0;
00096    hwnoflastframe = 0;
00097    hwnofcycles = 0;
00098    hwerrreg = 0;
00099    hwstatusreg = 0;
00100    erroroccured = 0;
00101    cycleserrors = 0;
00102    linenumber = 0;
00103    linenumbercount = 0;
00104    overallerrors = 0;
00105    
00106    //enable writing to the RCU
00107    initRcuAccess(NULL);
00108 
00109    //initialization of the registers
00110    result = init();
00111    if(result < 0){
00112     printf("Initialization failed: %d\n", result);
00113     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00114    }
00115    
00116    //create a logfile and write a header to it
00117    writeHeaderToLogfile();
00118 
00119    // test for the number of parameters
00120    if((argc != 2) && (argc != 3)) {
00121         perror("usage: framever <frames> [Cycles]\n");
00122         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00123    }
00124    
00125    // if no number of cycles is given use a default
00126    if(argv[2] == NULL){
00127     cyclestoreach = 2;
00128     printf("No Parameter for Cycles given, using Cycles = 2\n");
00129    }
00130    else{
00131     cyclestoreach = atoi(argv[2]);
00132     printf("Using given parameter %d for Cycles.\n", cyclestoreach);
00133    }
00134    printf("CyclestoReach: %d\n", cyclestoreach);
00135 
00136    // count the number of frames to be handled
00137    linenumbercount = linenumber = getLinesnumberFromFile(argv[1]);
00138 
00139 
00140    //open frames.txt for reading
00141    if((frames=fopen(argv[1],"r")) < 0){
00142         printf("Could not open %s for reading!\n",argv[1]);
00143         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00144    }
00145   
00146 
00147    //open logfile for writing   
00148    if((logfile=fopen("log.txt","a+b")) < 0){
00149         printf("Could not open %s for reading!\n",argv[1]);
00150         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00151    }
00152    else{
00153     printf("writing to logfile log.txt.\n");
00154    }
00155   
00156    sprintf(putline,"framever working on %d cycles.\n", cyclestoreach);
00157    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00158 
00159  
00160    //read and show the status registers
00161    hwnoferrorsreg = getErrorcounterReg();
00162    hwnoflastframewitherr = getLastErrorFramenumber();
00163    hwnoflastframe = getLastFramenumber();
00164    hwnofcycles = getNumberOfCycles();
00165    hwerrreg = readErrReg();
00166    hwstatusreg = readStatusReg();
00167         
00168    //printf("noferr: %d, lastframewitherr: %d, lastframe: %d, nofcycles: %d, ErrReg: %d, StatusReg: %d\n",hwnoferrorsreg, hwnoflastframewitherr, hwnoflastframe, hwnofcycles, hwerrreg, hwstatusreg);
00169 
00170 
00171    sprintf(putline,"Overview about the hardwareregisters before the actual work started:\n");
00172    printf("%s",  putline);
00173    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00174    sprintf(putline, "Read Error Counter Register (0xb104)   : %d\n", hwnoferrorsreg);
00175    printf("%s",  putline);
00176    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00177    sprintf(putline, "Last Frame with error (0xb105)         : %d\n", hwnoflastframewitherr);
00178    printf("%s",  putline);
00179    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00180    sprintf(putline, "Last read out frame(0xb106)            : %d\n",hwnoflastframe);
00181    printf("%s",  putline);
00182    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00183    sprintf(putline, "Error register (0xb101)                : %#x\n", hwerrreg);
00184    printf("%s",  putline);
00185    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00186    sprintf(putline, "Status register (0xb100)           : %#x\n\n", hwstatusreg);
00187    printf("%s",  putline);
00188    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00189    
00190    sprintf(putline, "Number of Frames found in %s    : %d\n\n", argv[1], linenumber);
00191    printf("%s",  putline);
00192    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00193 
00194    //as long as there are frames to be read
00195    if(frames!=NULL){
00196         //and as long as we havent reached the number of cycles to reach
00197     while(cycles < cyclestoreach){
00198 
00199        //read out time for for the folder generation
00200        time(&now);
00201        l_time = localtime(&now);
00202        strftime(mytime, sizeof mytime, "%T", l_time);
00203            
00204        //generate the folder for this cycle
00205        sprintf(foldername,"cycle_%d_%s",cycles, mytime);
00206        result = mkdir(foldername, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IXUSR | S_IRWXG | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH | S_IXOTH);
00207        if(result < 0){
00208         printf("failed creating folder %s - Error %d\n",foldername, result);
00209        }
00210 
00211 
00212        sprintf(putline, "current cycle: %d\n=============================\n", cycles);
00213        //printf("%s",  putline);
00214        fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00215        strftime(mytime, sizeof mytime, "%D - %T%n", l_time);
00216        
00217        sprintf(putline,"%s", mytime);
00218        //printf("%s",  putline);
00219        fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00220 
00221        linenumbercount = linenumber;
00222     
00223         //if there is something to readout
00224             while(fgets(line,255,frames)!=NULL){
00225     
00226             //read line from framesfile
00227         pframeaddress = &frameaddress[0];
00228             getFrameAddressFromLine(line, pframeaddress);
00229         pframeaddress = &frameaddress[0];
00230         block = frameaddress[0];
00231         major = frameaddress[1];
00232         minor = frameaddress[2];
00233         
00234     
00235 
00236             if(block != -1){
00237              //printf("processing %d, %d, %d\n",block, major, minor);
00238                      sprintf(ReadbackRawFrameFilename,"frame%d.%d.%d.hex",block,major,minor);
00239                      sprintf(ErrorFrameFilename,"Err_frame%d.%d.%d.hex",block,major,minor);
00240                      sprintf(RawFrameFilename,"raw/frame%d.%d.%d.hex",block,major,minor);
00241         
00242              //prepare for reading out
00243              result = step();
00244              if(result < 0)
00245                  printf("rcuSingleWrite failed (0xb000, 0x0100), Error: %d\n",result);
00246 
00247              //read the data
00248              result = rcuMultipleRead(0xb41c, 212, data);
00249                  //printf("read %d bytes from memory.\n",result);
00250     
00251              //get rid of the unused 16bit
00252              pSrc = (__u32*)&data[0];
00253                  pTgtoutput = pTgt = (__u16*)malloc(212*sizeof(__u16));
00254                  for(n=0;n<212;n++){
00255                         *pTgt=*((__u16*)pSrc);
00256                         pTgt++;
00257                         pSrc++;
00258                      }
00259 
00260              //printf("%s\n",foldername);
00261              // generate the filename the data will be written to
00262              strcpy(pathandfilename,foldername);
00263              strcat(pathandfilename,"/");
00264              strcat(pathandfilename,ReadbackRawFrameFilename);
00265 
00266              //printf("\n%s\n",pathandfilename);
00267         
00268              //write the readout data
00269                      if((rbrawfile=fopen(pathandfilename,"w+b")) < 0){
00270                         printf("Error opening %s for ascii writing!\n",pathandfilename);
00271                     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00272                      }
00273              //printf("done writing raw data to %s.\n", pathandfilename);
00274              //clear the filename
00275              strcpy(pathandfilename,"\0");
00276 
00277              //write the data to the file
00278                  fwrite(pTgtoutput, sizeof(__u16), 212, rbrawfile);
00279              
00280              fclose(rbrawfile);
00281 
00282              //open the raw File for reading and comparison
00283                      if((rawfile=fopen(RawFrameFilename,"r")) < 0){
00284                         printf("Error opening %s for reading!\n",RawFrameFilename);
00285                     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00286                      }
00287              fread(rawdata, sizeof(__u16), 212, rawfile);
00288              fclose(rawfile);
00289 
00290              // do an XOR with the read out data and the correct framefiles
00291              pRBData = (__u32*)&data[0];
00292              pRawData = &rawdata[0];
00293              pErrFileDataoutput = pErrFileData = (__u16*)&errfiledata[0];
00294 
00295              for(i = 0; i < 212; i++){
00296             *pErrFileData = ((*pRawData++))^((*pRBData++));
00297             //analyze for errors and count them
00298             erroroccured += analyze16bit(*pErrFileData);
00299             *pErrFileData++;
00300             //fprintf(stderr, "data=%#x rawdata=%#x errordata=%#x\n", data[i], rawdata[i], errfiledata[i]);
00301              }
00302            
00303              //if a bitflip was detected create an Errorfile wich contains the XOR data 
00304              if(erroroccured > 0){
00305                 //write the Errorfile   
00306                 strcpy(errpathandfilename,foldername);
00307                 strcat(errpathandfilename,"/");
00308                 strcat(errpathandfilename,ErrorFrameFilename);
00309             
00310             printf("found error in frame %d,%d,%d, writing errors to file %s\n", block, major, minor, errpathandfilename);
00311 
00312                         if((errfile=fopen(errpathandfilename,"w+b")) < 0){
00313                             printf("Error opening %s for reading!\n",ErrorFrameFilename);
00314                         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00315                          }
00316 
00317                 fwrite(pErrFileDataoutput, sizeof(__u16), 212, errfile);
00318 
00319                 fclose(errfile);
00320              }
00321             
00322              //read the status registers
00323              hwnoferrorsreg = getErrorcounterReg();
00324              hwnoflastframewitherr = getLastErrorFramenumber();
00325              hwnoflastframe = getLastFramenumber();
00326              hwnofcycles = getNumberOfCycles();
00327              hwerrreg = readErrReg();
00328              hwstatusreg = readStatusReg();
00329 /*
00330         if(hwerrreg != 0){
00331             printf("Hardware Error Register shows %d! - aborting.",hwerrreg);
00332             return EXIT_FAILURE;
00333         }
00334 */      
00335              
00336              //print the Errorregisters to the logfile
00337              sprintf(putline, "current frame: %d, %d, %d - Framenumber: %d\n----------------------------\n", block, major, minor, linenumbercount-1);
00338              fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00339              sprintf(putline, "Last read out frame(0xb106)      : %d\n",hwnoflastframe);
00340              fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00341              sprintf(putline, "Read Error Counter Register (0xb104): %d\n", hwnoferrorsreg);
00342              fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00343              sprintf(putline, "Last Frame with error (0xb105)       : %d\n", hwnoflastframewitherr);
00344              fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00345              //sprintf(putline, "Error register (0xb101)            : %#x %s\n", hwerrreg, getMeaningOfErrReg(hwerrreg));
00346              sprintf(putline, "Error register (0xb101)          : %#x\n", hwerrreg);
00347              fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00348              sprintf(putline, "Status register (0xb100)            : %#x\n", hwstatusreg);
00349              fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00350 
00351              
00352              sprintf(putline, "Bitflips found in this frame     : %d\n\n", erroroccured);
00353              fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00354 
00355              //add up the errors for the whole cycle
00356              cycleserrors+=erroroccured;
00357              erroroccured = 0;
00358 
00359     //       printf("Cycle: %d, noferr: %d, lastframewitherr: %d, lastframe: %d, nofcycles: %d, ErrReg: %d, StatusReg: %d\n",cycles, hwnoferrorsreg, hwnoflastframewitherr, hwnoflastframe, hwnofcycles, hwerrreg, hwstatusreg);
00360     
00361             //count the line Framenumbers like the hardware does
00362             linenumbercount--;  
00363             clearErrReg();
00364 
00365            }
00366 
00367        }
00368 
00369     //print detected bitflips to screen and logfile
00370     sprintf(putline, "Bitflips found in cycle %d        : %d\n", cycles, cycleserrors);
00371     printf("%s",  putline);
00372     fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00373         overallerrors+=cycleserrors;
00374     sprintf(putline, "Bitflips found so far               : %d\n",overallerrors);
00375     printf("%s",  putline);
00376     
00377     //reset and start new cycle
00378     cycleserrors=0;
00379     cycles++;       
00380     rewind(frames);
00381     }
00382    }
00383 
00384    //print all detected erorrs and clean up
00385    sprintf(putline, "Bitflips found during %d cycles with %d frames  : %d\n\n", cyclestoreach, linenumber, overallerrors);
00386    printf("%s",  putline);
00387    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00388    fclose(logfile);
00389    printf("closed logfile\n");
00390    free(pTgtoutput);
00391    printf("freed memory\n");
00392    fclose(frames);
00393    printf("closed framefile\n");
00394  //  printf("closed rawfile\n");
00395 
00396    releaseRcuAccess();
00397 
00398 return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00399 }
00400 
00401 int step(){
00402    int result;
00403    result = 0;
00404    result = rcuSingleWrite(0xb000,0x0100);
00405    usleep(1000);
00406    return result;
00407 }
00408 
00409 __u32 getErrorcounterReg(){
00410    __u32 u32rawData;
00411    if(rcuSingleRead(0xb104,&u32rawData) < 0){
00412     printf("rcuSingleRead failed: 0xb104.");
00413     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00414    }
00415 return u32rawData;
00416 }
00417 
00418 __u32 getLastErrorFramenumber(){
00419    __u32 u32rawData;
00420    if(rcuSingleRead(0xb105, &u32rawData) < 0){
00421     printf("rcuSingleRead failed: 0xb105.");
00422     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00423    }    
00424 return u32rawData;
00425 }
00426 
00427 __u32 getLastFramenumber(){
00428    __u32 u32rawData;
00429    if(rcuSingleRead(0xb106, &u32rawData) < 0){
00430     printf("rcuSingleRead failed: 0xb106.");
00431     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00432    }    
00433 return u32rawData;
00434 }
00435 
00436 __u32 getNumberOfCycles(){
00437    __u32 u32rawData;
00438    if(rcuSingleRead(0xb107, &u32rawData) < 0){
00439     printf("rcuSingleRead failed: 0xb107.");
00440     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00441    }        
00442 return u32rawData;
00443 }
00444 
00445 __u32 readStatusReg(){
00446    __u32 u32rawData;
00447    if(rcuSingleRead(0xb100, &u32rawData) < 0){
00448     printf("rcuSingleRead failed: 0xb100.");
00449     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00450    }        
00451 return u32rawData;
00452 }
00453 
00454 __u32 readErrReg(){
00455    __u32 u32rawData;
00456    if(rcuSingleRead(0xb101, &u32rawData) < 0){
00457     printf("rcuSingleRead failed: 0xb101.");
00458     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00459    }        
00460 return u32rawData;
00461 }
00462 
00463 int clearErrReg(){
00464    int result;
00465    result = 0;
00466    if(rcuSingleWrite(0xb000, 0x1) < 0){
00467     printf("rcuSingleWrite failed: 0xb000 0x1.");
00468     result = -1;
00469     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00470    }        
00471 return result;
00472 }
00473 
00474 int init(){
00475    int result;
00476    int data[1];
00477    __u32 *pData;
00478 
00479    data[0]=0xffffffff;
00480    result = 0;
00481    pData = (__u32*)&data[0];
00482    
00483    /* stops whatever the controller is doing */
00484    if(rcuSingleWrite(0xb000, 0x8000) < 0){
00485     printf("rcuSingleWrite failed: 0xb000, 0x8000\n");
00486     result=-1;
00487     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00488    }
00489    /* overwrites the selectmap memory */
00490    if(rcuMultipleWrite(0xb400, pData, 512, 2) < 0){
00491     printf("rcuMultipleWrite failed: 0xb400, 0xFFFF, 512, 2\n");
00492     result = -2;
00493     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00494    }
00495 
00496    /* overwrites the flash cache */
00497    if(rcuMultipleWrite(0xb200, pData, 512, 2) < 0){
00498     printf("rcuMultipleWrite failed: 0xb200, 0xFFFF, 512, 2\n");
00499     result=-3;
00500     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00501    }
00502 
00503    /* clear the error register */
00504    if(rcuSingleWrite(0xb000, 0x1) < 0){
00505     printf("rcuSingleWrite failed: 0xb000, 0x1\n");
00506     result=-4;
00507     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00508    }
00509    /* clear the status register */
00510    if(rcuSingleWrite(0xb000, 0x2) < 0){
00511     printf("rcuSingleWrite failed: 0xb000, 0x2\n");
00512     result=-5;
00513     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00514    }
00515 
00516 return result;
00517 }
00518 
00519 
00520 int writeHeaderToLogfile(){
00521    int result;
00522    char putline[128];
00523    FILE *logfile;
00524    //for the time
00525    struct tm *l_time;
00526    time_t now;
00527    char templine[64];
00528 
00529    result = 0;
00530 
00531    sprintf(putline,"Logfile was generated by FrameVer at ");
00532 
00533    //read out time for Timestamp in Logfile
00534    time(&now);
00535    l_time = localtime(&now);
00536    strftime(templine, sizeof templine, "%c", l_time);
00537 
00538    //open logfile for writing   
00539    if((logfile=fopen("log.txt","w+b")) < 0){
00540         printf("Could not open log.txt for reading!\n");
00541         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00542    }
00543 
00544    strcat(putline, templine);
00545    strcat(putline, "\n");
00546    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00547    strcpy(putline,"=============================================================\n\n");
00548    fwrite(putline, strlen(putline), 1, logfile);
00549    
00550 
00551    fclose(logfile);
00552 return result;
00553 }
00554 
00555 
00556 int analyze16bit(__u16 bitfield){
00557    int result;
00558    unsigned int bitcounter;
00559    result = 0;
00560    for(bitcounter=1<<(15); bitcounter!=0; bitcounter>>=1) //loop through all bits
00561         if ((bitcounter & bitfield) != 0) result++; // count 1-bits
00562 
00563 return result;
00564 }
00565 
00566 /*

00568   __u16 bitfield;
00569   bitfield = (__u16)value;

00572 
00573   strcpy(meaning,""); 
00574   
00575   if((bitfield & 1) != 0)
00576     strcat(meaning,"- Smap done failed");
00577   if(((bitfield>>=1) & 1) != 0)
00578     strcat(meaning,"- Smap busy not asserted error");
00579   if(((bitfield>>=1) & 1) != 0)
00580     strcat(meaning,"- Smap unknown command");
